result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary A Johnson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 208448,
Payable Number: 195259,
Receipt Number: 22R 016818,
Amount: $20.00

[MK] case called at 8:49am 
Defendant Gary A. Johnson in court with Attorney Yolanda Woodard  ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Woodard orally Motions for Dismissal based on lack of probable cause within the Criminal Complaint. 
Arguments given by Attorney Woodard.
The Court denies the Motion.  

Deputy J. Gonzalez- sworn and testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson
--cross examination by Attorney Woodard
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Johnson committed a felony; the Court binds him over for trial. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the Defense stands mute; pleas of "not guilty" are entered by the Court on the Defendant's behalf
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:47am

NEXT:   (1) Attorney Woodard is to file a Notice of Retainer by end of business today,  (2) Pretrial Conference on October 19th at 11:10am,  (3) Status Conference on November 18th at 2:30pm (along with Co-Defendant's case) with appearances by Zoom conference
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--no contact with the Co-Defendant [Dana L. Koger] (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--no possession of firearms 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription or as authorized by any treating physician 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

[MK] case called at 2:00pm  
Defendant Gary A Johnson appears by videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yolanda M Woodard. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with the Co-Defendant [Dana L. Koger]
--no possession of firearms 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription or as authorized by any treating physician 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess  2:05pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on September 14th at 9:00am,   (2) Preliminary Hearing on September 20th at 9:00am
